noun.description: A rattling noise, especially in the throat.

verb.description: To rattle; especially to make a rattling noise in the throat.

origin: Early 18th century; earliest use found in Gilbert Burnet (1643–1715), bishop of Salisbury and historian. From ruttle<br>late Middle English. Probably from Middle Low German rūtelen, to breathe stertorously, probably of imitative origin.
